                                                                        <archetype_id>
                                                                            <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.multimedia_source.v0</value>
                                                                        </archetype_id>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                                            <items id="text">Multimedia source</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">A multimedia resource that is generated or acquired during the provision of healthcare.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                                            <items id="text">Content</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Digital representation of the resource.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">The actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the content is stored elsewhere the external location can be referenced using the URI data type.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                                            <items id="text">Resource name</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Name or title of the multimedia resource.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                                            <items id="text">Created</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">The time, date, partial date or period when the resource was generated or authored.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                                            <items id="text">Availability digital imaging</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Narrative description about the resource.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the multimedia source not captured in other fields.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                                            <items id="text">Identifier</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Identifier for the resource.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                                            <items id="text">Source device</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Details about the device used to generate or author the resource.</items>
                                                                            <items id="comment">For example: the camera used to capture an image.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                                            <items id="text">Creator</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Details about the individual or organisation who generated or authored the resource.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                                            <items id="text">Additional details</items>
                                                                            <items id="description">Further details about the multimedia source.</items>
                                                                        </term_definitions>
                                                                    </children>
                                                                    <cardinality>
                                                                        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
                                                                        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
                                                                        <interval>
                                                                            <lower_included>true</lower_included>
                                                                            <upper_included>false</upper_included>
                                                                            <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
                                                                            <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                                                                            <lower>1</lower>
                                                                        </interval>
                                                                    </cardinality>
                                                                </attributes>
                                                                <archetype_id>
                                                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.specimen.v1</value>
                                                                </archetype_id>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                                    <items id="text">Specimen</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A physical sample collected from, or related to, an individual for the purpose of investigation, examination or analysis.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: Tissue or body fluid.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                                    <items id="text">Laboratory specimen identifier</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A unique identifier of the specimen, normally assigned by the laboratory.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">Sometimes called the Accession Identifier. Specimen containers, for example vacuum vials or tissue cassettes, have their own identitiers which may be recorded in the 'Container identifier' element in the 'Specimen container' archetype.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                                    <items id="text">Parent specimen identifier</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Unique identifier of the parent specimen, where the specimen is split into sub-samples.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: A specific histology slide specimen can have a specific paraffin wax block as its parent specimen.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                                    <items id="text">Hazard warning</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Identified health risk or biohazard to the collector or laboratory staff due to exposure to, or contact with, the specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Hepatitis B'; "nerve agent'. Coding of the 'Hazard warning' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                                    <items id="text">Collection method</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The method of collection used.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: venepuncture, biopsy, resection. Coding of the collection method with a terminology is preferred, where possible. If the collection method is included in the 'Specimen type' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                                                    <items id="text">Sampling context</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The context in which the specimen is collected.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'fasting'; 'full bladder'; 'sterile field'; or special instructions on the handling or immediate processing of the sample, such as 'centrifuge on receipt'. This data element also be used to document any known deviations from collection or handling instructions, for example that the patient had not fasted, even when this had been originally requested. Coding of the 'Sampling context' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

If this archetype is used within an INSTRUCTION archetype, the context will reflect the intended or desired conditions at sample collection. If this archetype is used for representing an ACTION archetype pathway step which correlates with the collection being performed or completed, the context will be reflecting the conditions that existed at sample collection and this may also be copied to the 'Confounding factors' element of the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result archetype.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                                    <items id="text">Structured source site</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A structured description of the area of the body from where the specimen is collected.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">Utilise the more detailed archetypes to describe structured or more complex anatomical sites, or to support recording the source site at run-time by the application. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'Source site' data element, this SLOT becomes redundant.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                                                    <items id="text">Year of sample collection</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The date and time that collection has been ordered to take place or has taken place.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">This datetime will be captured primarily in the INSTRUCTION timing, ACTION time or OBSERVATION times. However, as this is a critical piece of information, it can be useful to also associate it directly with the specimen itself.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                                                    <items id="text">Physical properties</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Physical dimensions, mass or non-measurable properties of the specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: Volume, mass, circumference, colour, smell, turbidity. This element can be used to specify the properties of the specimen to be collected, in the context of an INSTRUCTION archetype, or the properties of the specimen which was collected, in the context of an ACTION or OBSERVATION archetype. For example, an INSTRUCTION may request the collection of 20 ml of blood, while the corresponding ACTION records that only 15 ml was collected.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0029">
                                                                    <items id="text">Material Type</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The type of specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: Venous blood, bacterial culture, cytology, or tissue sample. Coding of the specimen type with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0034">
                                                                    <items id="text">Date/time received</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The date and time that the sample was received at the laboratory.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0041">
                                                                    <items id="text">Adequacy for testing</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Information about whether the specimen was adequate for testing.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">This element is intended to be used to record a judgement about whether or not the specimen quality was good enough for testing, and whether or not testing has been carried out. Coding of the specimen quality issues with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0042">
                                                                    <items id="text">Specimen quality issue</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A specific quality issue with a specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the specimen quality issues with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0045">
                                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the specimen not captured in other fields.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0052">
                                                                    <items id="text">Haemolysed</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen was haemolysed.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0053">
                                                                    <items id="text">Lipaemic</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen was lipaemic.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0054">
                                                                    <items id="text">Incorrect additive</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">An incorrect additive such as a transport medium or preservative was added to the specimen.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0055">
                                                                    <items id="text">Insufficient amount</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The available amount of specimen was insufficient to undertake the examination.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0062">
                                                                    <items id="text">Satisfactory</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen is of sufficient quality to allow reporting.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0063">
                                                                    <items id="text">Unsatisfactory - analysed</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen is unsatisfactory but has been analysed.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0064">
                                                                    <items id="text">Unsatisfactory - not analysed</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen is unsatisfactory and has not been analysed.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0067">
                                                                    <items id="text">Collection setting</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Identification of the physical setting in which the specimen is collected.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: laboratory outpatient clinic, at home, or hospital ward. This specifies the type of specimen collection location within the healthcare environment. The specimen collection setting may provide additional information relevant to the analysis of the result.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0068">
                                                                    <items id="text">Processing details</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Structured details about preparation or processing of the specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: Staining or fixation.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0070">
                                                                    <items id="text">Specimen collector identifier</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Identifier of the person or organisation responsible for collecting the specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">This element is intended to be used where the specimen has already been collected and the actual collector is known.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0071">
                                                                    <items id="text">Specimen collector details</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The person or organisation responsible for collecting the specimen.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0079">
                                                                    <items id="text">Collection description</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Narrative description about the collection of the specimen.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0080">
                                                                    <items id="text">Number of containers</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The total number of physical units holding this specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: Number of buckets, jars, vials, tubes, blocks, slides or grids.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0083">
                                                                    <items id="text">Additional collection details</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Addtional details related to specific collection methods.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example details about needle biopsies in prostate cancer, where both the request and reporting about the specimen are detailed and specific.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0085">
                                                                    <items id="text">Container details</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Details about containers used.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0087">
                                                                    <items id="text">Source site</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Identification of the body site or other location from where the specimen is collected.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'wound on left calf', 'IV cannula right arm', 'right kidney'.
Coding of the name of the source site with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Use this data element to record precoordinated source sites. If the requirements for recording the source site are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the 'Structured source site' SLOT in this archetype. If the source site is included in the 'Specimen type' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0088">
                                                                    <items id="text">Sample ID</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">A unique identifier of the specimen, assigned by a party external to the laboratory.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Requester ID', 'Archive ID, 'Biobank ID'.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0089">
                                                                    <items id="text">Icteric</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen was icteric.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0090">
                                                                    <items id="text">Handling error</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">An error arose when handling the specimen. For example: Incorrect storage, broken container.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0091">
                                                                    <items id="text">Age</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen was too old to analyse or to analyse accurately.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0092">
                                                                    <items id="text">Technical failure</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen could not be analysed for technical reasons.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0093">
                                                                    <items id="text">Transport details</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Structured details about transport of the specimen.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0094">
                                                                    <items id="text">Clotted</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen was clotted.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0095">
                                                                    <items id="text">Incorrectly labelled</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">The specimen was labelled incorrectly.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                <term_definitions code="at0096">
                                                                    <items id="text">Digital representation</items>
                                                                    <items id="description">Structured details about a digital representation of the specimen.</items>
                                                                    <items id="comment">For example the scanned image of a histopathology slide.</items>
                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                            </children>

                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Digital imaging invasion front</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">A multimedia resource that is generated or acquired during the provision of healthcare.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Content</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">Digital representation of the resource.</items>
                                                                                    <items id="comment">The actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the content is stored elsewhere the external location can be referenced using the URI data type.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Resource name</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">Name or title of the multimedia resource.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Created</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">The time, date, partial date or period when the resource was generated or authored.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Availability invasion front digital imaging</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">Narrative description about the resource.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the multimedia source not captured in other fields.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Identifier</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">Identifier for the resource.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Source device</items>
                                                                                    <items id="description">Details about the device used to generate or author the resource.</items>
                                                                                    <items id="comment">For example: the camera used to capture an image.</items>
                                                                                </term_definitions>
                                                                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                                                    <items id="text">Creator</items>

                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result.v1</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="text">Laboratory test result</items>
                                    <items id="description">The result, including findings and the laboratory's interpretation, of an investigation performed on specimens collected from an individual or related to that individual.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="text">Event Series</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="text">Any event</items>
                                    <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="text">Test name</items>
                                    <items id="description">Name of the laboratory investigation performed on the specimen(s).</items>
                                    <items id="comment">A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. It is strongly recommended that 'Test name' be coded with a terminology, for example LOINC or SNOMED CT. For example: 'Glucose', 'Urea and Electrolytes', 'Swab', 'Cortisol (am)', 'Potassium in perspiration' or 'Melanoma histopathology'. The name may sometimes include specimen type and patient state, for example 'Fasting blood glucose' or include other information, as 'Potassium (PNA blood gas)'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                    <items id="text">Receiving laboratory</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">This slot is intended to carry details of the laboratory which received the request and has overall responsibility to manage reporting of the test, even if other labs perform specific aspects.

The receiving laboratory may either perform the test or refer it to another laboratory. Where a different laboratory is responsible for performing the testing on specific analytes, it would be expected that these details would be carried in the 'Analyte result detail' SLOT within the CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte archetype.

</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0035">
                                    <items id="text">Distribution list</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the test result.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0037">
                                    <items id="text">Partial</items>
                                    <items id="description">This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) Test Result: data in the Test Result may be incomplete or unverified.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0038">
                                    <items id="text">Final</items>
                                    <items id="description">The Test result is complete and verified by an authorised person.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0040">
                                    <items id="text">Amended</items>
                                    <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0057">
                                    <items id="text">Conclusion</items>
                                    <items id="description">Narrative description of the key findings.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Pattern suggests significant renal impairment'. The content of the conclusion will vary, depending on the investigation performed. This conclusion should be aligned with the coded 'Test diagnosis'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0062">
                                    <items id="text">Requester order identifier</items>
                                    <items id="description">The local identifier assigned by the requesting clinical system.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0063">
                                    <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
                                    <items id="description">The local identifier assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Assigning an identifier to a request by the Laboratory lnformation System (LIS) enables tracking progress of the request and enables linking results to requests. It also provides a reference to assist with enquiries and it is usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0065">
                                    <items id="text">Specimen detail</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details about the physical substance that has been analysed.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">If the specimen type is sufficiently specified with a code in the Test name, then this additional data is not required. Linking results to specific specimens may be recorded using 'Specimen identifier' elements in both the CLUSTER.specimen and the various results CLUSTER archetypes.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0068">
                                    <items id="text">Laboratory internal identifier</items>
                                    <items id="description">A local identifier assigned by the receiving Laboratory Information System (LIS) to track the test process.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">This identifier is an internal tracking number assigned by the LIS, and it not intended to be the name of the test.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0073">
                                    <items id="text">Overall test status</items>
                                    <items id="description">The status of the laboratory test result as a whole.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">The values have been specifically chosen to match those in the HL7 FHIR Diagnostic report, historically derived from HL7v2 practice. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'.

This element is multiple occurrence to cater for the use cases where statuses for different aspects of the result have been split into several elements.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0074">
                                    <items id="text">Cancelled</items>
                                    <items id="description">The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0075">
                                    <items id="text">Overall test status timestamp</items>
                                    <items id="description">The date and/or time that ‘Overall test status’ was issued.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0077">
                                    <items id="text">Diagnostic service category</items>
                                    <items id="description">The diagnostic service or discipline that is responsible for the laboratory test result.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">This is intended to be a general categorisation and not to capture the organisational name of the laboratory. For example: anatomical pathology, immunology and transfusion medicine, medical microbiology, clinical pharmacology, medical genetics, medical biochemistry. Alternatively more granular sub categories or sub disciplines, such as endocrinology, haematology, and allergology services, may be used. This may assist clinicians in filtering between categories of results. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0090">
                                    <items id="text">Requester</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of the clinician or organisation requesting the laboratory test result.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0094">
                                    <items id="text">Test request details</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details about the test request.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">In most situations there is one test request and a single corresponding test result, however this repeating cluster allows for the situation where there may be multiple test requests reported using a single test result.

As an example: 'a clinician asks for blood glucose in one request and Urea/electrolytes in a second request, but the lab analyser does both and the lab wishes to report these together'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0097">
                                    <items id="text">Test result</items>
                                    <items id="description">Results of the test performed on the specimen(s).</items>
                                    <items id="comment">This SLOT may carry an individual analyte, a group, panel or battery of multiple analytes, or a more complex and specific structure.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0098">
                                    <items id="text">Test diagnosis</items>
                                    <items id="description">Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the laboratory test result.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Severe hepatic impairment', 'Salmonella contamination'. Coding of the diagnosis with a terminology is strongly recommended, where possible. This diagnosis should be aligned with the narrative in the 'Conclusion'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0100">
                                    <items id="text">Clinical information provided</items>
                                    <items id="description">Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0101">
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the test result not captured in other fields.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0106">
                                    <items id="text">Original test requested name</items>
                                    <items id="description">Name of the original laboratory test requested.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">This data element is to be used when the test requested differs from the test actually performed by the laboratory.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0107">
                                    <items id="text">Registered</items>
                                    <items id="description">The existence of the test is registered in the Laboratory Information System, but there is nothing yet available.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0110">
                                    <items id="text">Testing details</items>
                                    <items id="description">Structured details about the method of analysis, device or interpretation used.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'details of ELISA/nephelometry'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0111">
                                    <items id="text">Point-of-care test</items>
                                    <items id="description">This indicates whether the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT) as opposed to a formal result from a laboratory or other service delivery organisation.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">True if the test was performed directly at Point-of-Care (POCT).</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0112">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0113">
                                    <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
                                    <items id="description">Issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">'Confounding factors' should be reserved for uncontrolled/unplanned issues of patient state/physiology that might affect interpretation, for example 'recent exercise' or 'recent tobacco smoking'.

Known or required preconditions, such as 'fasting' should be carried in the 'Sampling conditions' element within the CLUSTER.specimen archetype . In some cases preconditions are captured as part of the test name, for example 'Fasting blood glucose'.

Known issues with specimen collection or handling, such as 'prolonged use of tourniquet' or 'sample haemolysed', should be carried in the 'Specimen quality' elements within CLUSTER.specimen archetype.

Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0114">
                                    <items id="text">Structured confounding factors</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of issues or circumstances that impact on the accurate interpretation of the measurement or test result.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: Last Normal Menstrual Period (LNMP).</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0115">
                                    <items id="text">Corrected</items>
                                    <items id="description">The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0116">
                                    <items id="text">Entered in error</items>
                                    <items id="description">The Test Result has been withdrawn following previous Final release.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0117">
                                    <items id="text">Extension</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0118">
                                    <items id="text">Multimedia representation</items>
                                    <items id="description">Digital image, video or diagram representing the test result.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Multiple formats are allowed but they should represent equivalent clinical content.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0119">
                                    <items id="text">Appended</items>
                                    <items id="description">Subsequent to being final, the report has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0120">
                                    <items id="text">Preliminary</items>
                                    <items id="description">Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0121">
                                    <items id="text">Test method</items>
                                    <items id="description">Description about the method used to perform the test.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0122">
                                    <items id="text">Structured test diagnosis</items>
                                    <items id="description">A structured or complex diagnosis for the laboratory test.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: Anatomical pathology diagnoses consisting of several different axes such as morphology, etiology and function.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                            </children>
