                                                <archetype_id>
                                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.synoptic_details_colorectal_carcinoma.v0</value>
                                                </archetype_id>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="text">Synoptic details - Colorectal cancer</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Synoptic findings about colorectal cancer found on histopathological examination.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                    <items id="text">Microscopic findings</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Microscopic anatomical pathology findings related to colorectal cancer.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                    <items id="text">pTNM classification</items>
                                                    <items id="description">pTNM pathological classification.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                    <items id="text">Details</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details of response to neoadjuvant therapy.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example different grading systems</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                    <items id="text">Macroscopic findings</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Macroscopic anatomical pathology findings related to colorectal cancer.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                    <items id="text">Tumour dimensions</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details of maximum dimensions of the tumour.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                    <items id="text">Resection margin</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details about a specified resection margin, including the distance from the tumour to the margin.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                    <items id="text">Maximum extramuscular extension</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The maximum extramuscular extension of the tumour.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                                    <items id="text">Anastomotic doughnuts submitted</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Have anastomotic doughnuts been submitted for analysis?</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                                    <items id="text">Tumour perforation</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings related to tumour perforation.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                    <items id="text">Tumour perforation</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Finding of tumour perforation. Tumor perforation is a macroscopically visible defect through the tumor, so that the bowel lumen is in communication with the external surface of the resection specimen.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                    <items id="text">Perforation location</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The location of a perforation, if present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Narrative comment on the perforation.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                    <items id="text">For rectal tumours</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings related solely to rectal tumours.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                                    <items id="text">Relationship to anterior peritoneal reflection</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The relationship of rectal tumour to the lowest level of the anterior peritoneal reflection.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                                    <items id="text">Intactness of the mesorectum</items>
                                                    <items id="description">An assessment of the intactness of the mesorectum. The specimen is scored according to the worst area.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Presence of tumour perforation has not been determined.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                                    <items id="text">Present</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Tumour perforation is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                                    <items id="text">Absent</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Tumour perforation is absent.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                                    <items id="text">Retro/infra peritoneal</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The perforation is retro/infra peritoneal.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                                    <items id="text">Serosal</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The perforation is serosal.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                                                    <items id="text">Entirely above</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The tumour is entirely above the level of the peritoneal reflection anteriorly.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                                                    <items id="text">Astride</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The tumour is astride (or at)  the level of the peritoneal reflection anteriorly.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                                    <items id="text">Entirely below</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The tumour is entirely below the level of the peritoneal reflection anteriorly.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                                    <items id="text">Incomplete</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Little bulk of mesorectum, very irregular with defects down to the muscularis propria.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                                                    <items id="text">Nearly complete</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Moderate bulk of mesorectum. Irregular surface with defects greater than 5 mm, but not extending to the muscularis propria. Moderate degree of coning may be seen.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                                                    <items id="text">Complete</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A good bulk of mesorectum with a smooth surface. No coning near the tumor. No defects more than 5 mm deep.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0028">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Intactness of the mesorectum has not been determined.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                                                    <items id="text">Lymph node findings</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings related to the involvement of tumour in lymph nodes.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0033">
                                                    <items id="text">Morphology</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Histologic classification of the tumour.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">Use of a terminology is preferred. Commonly the WHO classification is used.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0034">
                                                    <items id="text">Adenocarcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Usual type of colorectal carcinoma.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0035">
                                                    <items id="text">Mucinous adenocarcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Variant of adenocarcinoma with more than 50% extracellular mucin.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0036">
                                                    <items id="text">Signet ring cell carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Variant of adenocarcinoma with more than 50% signet ring cells.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0037">
                                                    <items id="text">Squamous cell carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Primary squamous carcinoma excluding upwardly spreading anal tumours.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0038">
                                                    <items id="text">Adenosquamous carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A neoplasm comprising both adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                                                    <items id="text">Medullary carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Variant with a solid architecture and prominent tumor infiltrating lymphocytes.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0040">
                                                    <items id="text">Neuroendocrine tumour G1</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A tumour with neuroendocrine features and a mitotic sount <2 per 10 HPF  and/or < 3% Ki67 index.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0041">
                                                    <items id="text">Undifferentiated carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Carcinoma without gland formation, mucin, squamous or neuroendocrine differentiation.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0087">
                                                    <items id="text">Lymph node detail</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings related to the involvement of tumour in lymph nodes.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0179">
                                                    <items id="text">Additional findings</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Additional histopathological findings.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0220">
                                                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A text description of additional findings.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0250">
                                                    <items id="text">Additional finding</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A single additional histopathological finding.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0263">
                                                    <items id="text">Distant metastasis</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings related to distant metastasis.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0264">
                                                    <items id="text">Distant metastasis</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings of histologically confirmed distant metastasis.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0265">
                                                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A text description of distant metastases.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0269">
                                                    <items id="text">Histological grading</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Histological tumour grade.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0271">
                                                    <items id="text">WHO version</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A text comment on histological grading.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0277">
                                                    <items id="text">Small vessel invasion</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details of tumour invasion in thin-walled structures (lymphatics, capillaries, venules).</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0278">
                                                    <items id="text">Local tissue invasion</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings related to local tissue invasion by tumour.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0281">
                                                    <items id="text">Number of tumour deposits</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Number of  tumour deposits. Only relevant if lymph node metastasis is absent.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0284">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Presence of tumour deposits has not been determined.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0286">
                                                    <items id="text">Perineural invasion</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details of perineural invasion by tumour.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0287">
                                                    <items id="text">Sites</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details of sites of histologically confirmed distant metastases.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0293">
                                                    <items id="text">Synchronous carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Synchronous carcinoma is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0294">
                                                    <items id="text">Ulcerative colitis</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Ulcerative colitis is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0295">
                                                    <items id="text">Ulcerative colitis with dysplasia</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Ulcerative colitis with dysplasia is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0296">
                                                    <items id="text">Crohn's disease</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Crohn's disease is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0297">
                                                    <items id="text">Crohn's disease with dysplasia</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Crohn's disease with dysplasia is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0309">
                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A text comment on the microscopic findings.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0323">
                                                    <items id="text">Distance of invasion</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Maximal distance of tumour invasion beyond the muscularis propria.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">Only applicable for tumors invading beyond the muscularis propria (T3) and not yet having invaded the peritoneum or adjacent structures.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0330">
                                                    <items id="text">Neoadjuvant therapy given</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Has neoadjuvant therapy been given?</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0331">
                                                    <items id="text">Yes</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Neoadjuvant therapy has been given.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0332">
                                                    <items id="text">No</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Neoadjuvant therapy has not been given.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0333">
                                                    <items id="text">Not known</items>
                                                    <items id="description">It is not known if neoadjuvant therapy has been given.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0338">
                                                    <items id="text">Number of polyps</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Number of polyps specified above.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0340">
                                                    <items id="text">Diverticulosis</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Diverticulosis is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0348">
                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                    <items id="description">An additional text comment on lymph node findings.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0359">
                                                    <items id="text">Type of polyp</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Type of polyp. Coding of the specific polyp with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0362">
                                                    <items id="text">Present</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Evidence of distant metastasis.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0363">
                                                    <items id="text">Absent</items>
                                                    <items id="description">No evidence of distant metastasis.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0364">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Evidence of metastasis has not been determined.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0365">
                                                    <items id="text">Status of apical lymph node</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Status of the highest lymph node closest to the main vascular tie(s).</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0366">
                                                    <items id="text">Polyps</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Findings of polyps.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0367">
                                                    <items id="text">Polyposis syndrome</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Evidence of polyposis syndrome.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0368">
                                                    <items id="text">Present</items>
                                                    <items id="description">There is evidence of polyposis syndrome.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0369">
                                                    <items id="text">Absent</items>
                                                    <items id="description">There is no evidence of polyposis syndrome.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0370">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Evidence of polyposis syndrome has not been determined.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0371">
                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Comment concerning  polyps.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0372">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Relationship to anterior peritoneal reflection has not been determined.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0373">
                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A text comment on the macroscopic findings.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0374">
                                                    <items id="text">Large vessel (venous) invasion</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details of venous tumour invasion.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0376">
                                                    <items id="text">Metastasis present</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A metastasis in the highest lymph node is detected.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0377">
                                                    <items id="text">Metastasis absent</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A metastasis in the highest lymph node is not detected.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0378">
                                                    <items id="text">Equivocal</items>
                                                    <items id="description">It is uncertain whether a metastasis is present or not.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0379">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The status of the highest lymph node could not be assessed, e.g. because the resection did not contain an apical lymph node.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0380">
                                                    <items id="text">Not applicable</items>
                                                    <items id="description">If positive lymph nodes are present, the status of tumour deposits is irrelevant and thus not applicable.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0381">
                                                    <items id="text">1</items>
                                                    <items id="description">One tumor deposit is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0382">
                                                    <items id="text">2</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Two tumor deposits are present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0383">
                                                    <items id="text">3</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Three tumor deposits are present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0384">
                                                    <items id="text">4</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Four tumor deposits are present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0385">
                                                    <items id="text">5</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Five tumor deposits are present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0386">
                                                    <items id="text">>5</items>
                                                    <items id="description">More than five tumor deposits are present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0387">
                                                    <items id="text">Equivocal</items>
                                                    <items id="description">It is uncertain whether tumor deposits are present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0388">
                                                    <items id="text">0</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Tumor deposits are absent.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0389">
                                                    <items id="text">Response to neoadjuvant therapy</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Assessment of response to neoadjuvant therapy.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0390">
                                                    <items id="text">Description</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Text description of regression changes after neoadjuvant therapy.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0391">
                                                    <items id="text">Grade</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Histological grading system for colorectal carcinoma.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">Only adenocarcinomas (not otherwise specified) are graded with a grading system. Squamous cell carcinomas are graded with 3 grades. Tumours after neoadjuvant therapy are not graded. </items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0403">
                                                    <items id="text">Tumour deposits</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Details about tumour deposits.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">Tumour deposits (satellites) are discrete macroscopic or microscopic nodules of cancer in the pericolorectal adipose tissue’s lymph drainage area of a primary carcinoma that are discontinuous from the primary and without histological evidence of residual lymph node or identifiable vascular or neural structures. </items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0404">
                                                    <items id="text">Assessment of tumour deposits</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Simple assessment of tumour deposits.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0405">
                                                    <items id="text">Present</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Tumour deposits are detected.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0406">
                                                    <items id="text">Absent</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Tumour deposits are not detected.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0407">
                                                    <items id="text">Equivocal</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Det er uncertain whether tumour deposits are present or absent.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0408">
                                                    <items id="text">Indeterminate</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Presence or absence of tumour deposits has not been assessed.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0409">
                                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Comment on tumour deposits.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0410">
                                                    <items id="text">Adenocarcinoma, cribriform comedo-type</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Carcinoma with extensive large cribriform glands with central necrosis.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0411">
                                                    <items id="text">Adenocarcinoma, micropapillary type</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Variant with small clusters of tumor cells within stromal spaces.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0412">
                                                    <items id="text">Adenocarcinoma, serrated type</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Variant with glandular serration similar to a sessile serrated polyp.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0413">
                                                    <items id="text">Spindle cell carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A biphasic carcinoma with a spindle- cell sarcomatoid component in which the tumour cells are at least focally immunoreactive for keratins.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0414">
                                                    <items id="text">Neuroendocrine tumour G2</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A tumour with neuroendocrine features and a mitotic sount 2-20 per 10 HPF  and/or 3-20% Ki67 index.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0415">
                                                    <items id="text">Neuroendocrine carcinoma, large cell</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A carcinoma with neurendocrine features composed of intermediate to large cells with a mitotic count >20 per 10 HPF and/or >20% Ki67 index.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0416">
                                                    <items id="text">Neuroendocrine carcinoma, small cell</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A carcinoma with neurendocrine features composed of small cells with a mitotic count >20 per 10 HPF and/or >20% Ki67 index.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0417">
                                                    <items id="text">Mixed adenoneuroendocrine carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A carcinoma with morphologicalle recognizable phenotype composed of both epithelial and neuroendocrine elements where at least 30% of either component is identified.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0418">
                                                    <items id="text">Neuroendocrine carcinoma</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A carcinoma with neurendocrine features and a mitotic count >20 per 10 HPF and/or >20% Ki67 index.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0419">
                                                    <items id="text">Equivocal</items>
                                                    <items id="description">It is uncertain whether a polyposis syndrome is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0420">
                                                    <items id="text">Equivocal</items>
                                                    <items id="description">It is uncertain whether a tumour perforation is present.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>

                                                <node_id/>
                                                <item xsi:type="C_STRING">
                                                    <list>Cancer diagnosis</list>
                                                </item>
                                            </children>
                                        </attributes>
                                    </children>
                                </attributes>
                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.v1</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="text">Cancer diagnosis</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="text">structure</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="text">Problem/Diagnosis name</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">Date/time clinically recognised</items>
                                    <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time the diagnosis or problem was recognised by a healthcare professional.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of clinical recognition" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="text">Severity</items>
                                    <items id="description">An assessment of the overall severity of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">If severity is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. Note: more specific grading of severity can be recorded using the Specific details SLOT.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="text">Clinical description</items>
                                    <items id="description">Narrative description about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Use to provide background and context, including evolution, episodes or exacerbations, progress and any other relevant details, about the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="text">Localization of primary tumor</items>
                                    <items id="description">Identification of a simple body site for the location of the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the anatomical location with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Use this data element to record precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Structured anatomical location' SLOT in this archetype. Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as describing a rash in multiple locations but where all of the other attributes are identical. If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant. 

</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                                    <items id="text">Date/time of resolution</items>
                                    <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time of resolution or remission for this problem or diagnosis, as determined by a healthcare professional.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Partial dates are acceptable. If the subject of care is under the age of one year, then the complete date or a minimum of the month and year is necessary to enable accurate age calculations - for example, if used to drive decision support. Data captured/imported as "Age at time of resolution" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.
</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0032">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                                    <items id="text">Structured body site</items>
                                    <items id="description">A structured anatomical location for the problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Use this SLOT to insert the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location archetypes if the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations.

If the anatomical location is included in the Problem/diagnosis name via precoordinated codes, use of this SLOT becomes redundant.

</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0043">
                                    <items id="text">Specific details</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details that are additionally required to record as unique attributes of this problem or diagnosis.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">May include structured detail about the grading or staging of the diagnosis; diagnostic criteria, classification criteria or formal severity assessments such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0046">
                                    <items id="text">Status</items>
                                    <items id="description">Structured details for location-, domain-, episode- or workflow-specific aspects of the diagnostic process.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Use status or context qualifiers with care, as they are variably used in practice and interoperability cannot be assured unless usage is clearly defined with the community of use. For example: active status - active, inactive, resolved, in remission; evolution status - initial, interim/working, final; temporal status - current, past; episodicity status - first, new, ongoing; admission status - admission, discharge; or priority status - primary, secondary.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0047">
                                    <items id="text">Mild</items>
                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis does not interfere with normal activity or may cause damage to health if left untreated.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0048">
                                    <items id="text">Moderate</items>
                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis causes interference with normal activity or will damage health if left untreated.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0049">
                                    <items id="text">Severe</items>
                                    <items id="description">The problem or diagnosis prevents normal activity or will seriously damage health if left untreated.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0069">
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the problem or diagnosis not captured in other fields.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0070">
                                    <items id="text">Last updated</items>
                                    <items id="description">The date this problem or diagnosis was last updated.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0071">
                                    <items id="text">Extension</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0072">
                                    <items id="text">Course description</items>
                                    <items id="description">Narrative description about the course of the problem or diagnosis since onset.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0073">
                                    <items id="text">Diagnostic certainty</items>
                                    <items id="description">The level of confidence in the identification of the diagnosis.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0074">
                                    <items id="text">Suspected</items>
                                    <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a low level of certainty.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0075">
                                    <items id="text">Probable</items>
                                    <items id="description">The diagnosis has been identified with a high level of certainty.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0076">
                                    <items id="text">Confirmed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The diagnosis has been confirmed against recognised criteria.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0077">
                                    <items id="text">Date/time of onset</items>
                                    <items id="description">Estimated or actual date/time that signs or symptoms of the problem/diagnosis were first observed.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Data captured/imported as "Age at onset" should be converted to a date using the subject's date of birth.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                            </children>

                            </cardinality>

                                        <archetype_id>
                                            <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.timing_nondaily.v1</value>
                                        </archetype_id>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                            <items id="text">Surgery timing</items>
                                            <items id="description">Structured information about the intended timing pattern for a therapeutic or diagnostic activity occurring over days, weeks, months or years.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                            <items id="text">Specific date</items>
                                            <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific date or a specific range of dates.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'on 12 Jan 2017' or 'on 30 Oct 2017 to 6 Nov 2017'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                            <items id="text">Repetition interval</items>
                                            <items id="description">The interval between repetitions of the activity.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'Every 3 weeks'. If necessary, this element can be used to explicity specify that an activity is to take place every single day, by setting it to "1 day".</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                            <items id="text">Specific day of week</items>
                                            <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific day of the week.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'On Monday, Wednesday and Friday'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                            <items id="text">Specific day of month</items>
                                            <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific day or interval of days of the month.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'on the 3rd, 13th and 23rd of each month' or 'on the 1st to the 10th of each month'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                            <items id="text">From event</items>
                                            <items id="description">The name of the event that triggers the activity to take place.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">This element is intended for events that can occur at variable dates, such as onset of menstruation, and not for doses or activities that are conditional on a different varable. If required, the event name can be coded using a terminology, which could potentially be used to trigger an application to set a concrete date for the activity.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                            <items id="text">Surgery</items>
                                            <items id="description">The activity should take place in relation to a specific named event.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                            <items id="text">Monday</items>
                                            <items id="description">The activity should take place on Monday.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                            <items id="text">Tuesday</items>
                                            <items id="description">The activity should take place on Tuesday.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                            <items id="text">Surgery start relative</items>
                                            <items id="description">The period of time before or after the named event when the activity should take place. Negative durations can be used to signify that the activity should be taken before a known event.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: '3 days after onset of menstruation = menstrual onset + 3 days', '2 weeks prior to admission= admission -2 weeks'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                            <items id="text">On / off cycle</items>
                                            <items id="description">A cycle of activity where an on-off pattern is required.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'take for 1 week, omit 2 weeks, repeat 4 times'</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                            <items id="text">On</items>
                                            <items id="description">The period of time for which the activity should take place.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                            <items id="text">Off</items>
                                            <items id="description">The period of time for which the activity should NOT take place.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                            <items id="text">Repetitions</items>
                                            <items id="description">The number of repetitions of the on/off cycle.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                            <items id="text">Frequency</items>
                                            <items id="description">The number of days per time period on which the activity is to take place.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: '3 times per week', '2-4 times per month'.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                            <items id="text">Wednesday</items>

                                        </term_definitions>

                                        </term_definitions>

                                        </term_definitions>

                                        </term_definitions>
                                        <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                            <items id="text">Timing description</items>
                                            <items id="description">Text description of the timing.</items>
                                            <items id="comment">For example: 'Use for one week, then stop for two weeks, then repeat'. This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for daily timings without necessarily specifying the non-daily timings in a structured way.</items>
                                        </term_definitions>
