                                                <archetype_id>
                                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.timing_nondaily.v1</value>
                                                </archetype_id>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="text">Pharmacotherapy timing</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Structured information about the intended timing pattern for a therapeutic or diagnostic activity occurring over days, weeks, months or years.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                    <items id="text">Specific date</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific date or a specific range of dates.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'on 12 Jan 2017' or 'on 30 Oct 2017 to 6 Nov 2017'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                    <items id="text">Repetition interval</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The interval between repetitions of the activity.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Every 3 weeks'. If necessary, this element can be used to explicity specify that an activity is to take place every single day, by setting it to "1 day".</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                    <items id="text">Specific day of week</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific day of the week.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'On Monday, Wednesday and Friday'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                    <items id="text">Specific day of month</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific day or interval of days of the month.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'on the 3rd, 13th and 23rd of each month' or 'on the 1st to the 10th of each month'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                    <items id="text">From event</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The name of the event that triggers the activity to take place.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">This element is intended for events that can occur at variable dates, such as onset of menstruation, and not for doses or activities that are conditional on a different varable. If required, the event name can be coded using a terminology, which could potentially be used to trigger an application to set a concrete date for the activity.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                    <items id="text">Start of pharmacotherapy</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place in relation to a specific named event.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                    <items id="text">Monday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Monday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                                    <items id="text">Tuesday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Tuesday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                                    <items id="text">Date of start of pharmacotherapy</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time before or after the named event when the activity should take place. Negative durations can be used to signify that the activity should be taken before a known event.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '3 days after onset of menstruation = menstrual onset + 3 days', '2 weeks prior to admission= admission -2 weeks'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                    <items id="text">On / off cycle</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A cycle of activity where an on-off pattern is required.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'take for 1 week, omit 2 weeks, repeat 4 times'</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                    <items id="text">On</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time for which the activity should take place.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                    <items id="text">Off</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time for which the activity should NOT take place.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                    <items id="text">Repetitions</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The number of repetitions of the on/off cycle.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                                    <items id="text">Frequency</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The number of days per time period on which the activity is to take place.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '3 times per week', '2-4 times per month'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                                    <items id="text">Wednesday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Wednesday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                                    <items id="text">Thursday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Thursday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                                    <items id="text">Friday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Friday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                                    <items id="text">Saturday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Saturday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                                    <items id="text">Sunday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Sunday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                                    <items id="text">Timing description</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Text description of the timing.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Use for one week, then stop for two weeks, then repeat'. This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for daily timings without necessarily specifying the non-daily timings in a structured way.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                            </children>
                                            <cardinality>

                                                    <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                                                    <lower>0</lower>
                                                </interval>
                                            </cardinality>
                                        </attributes>
                                    </children>

                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.medication.v1</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="text">Medication management</items>
                                    <items id="description">Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription issued</items>
                                    <items id="description">A prescription has been issued for the medication.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription dispensed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The ordered medication has been dispensed, for example from a pharmacy to the patient.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="text">Medication course commenced</items>
                                    <items id="description">The medication has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time. Although in some settings this significant date may be computable as the first of several administrations, in other settings, such as primary care, specific administration dates are not readily available.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                    <items id="text">Medication reassessed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The individual medication has been reassessed, for example whether the medication should still be taken. This is not intended to capture review of the medication list.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                    <items id="text">Dose administered</items>
                                    <items id="description">A single administration of the medication has taken place.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                    <items id="text">Medication course completed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The medication course has been completed as planned.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription supply delayed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The prescription has not been dispensed due to a technical or pharamaceutical supply issue.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                    <items id="text">Administrations suspended</items>
                                    <items id="description">The administration of the medication has been suspended until further notice. No further doses should be given until the restart date or conditions have been met. When setting the date/conditions for restart after suspending, a step from ‘Administrations suspended’ and back to 'Medication start date/condition set' should be performed.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription re-issued</items>
                                    <items id="description">A prescription has been re-issued for an existing medication order.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription re-authorisation pending</items>
                                    <items id="description">Issue of the prescription is awaiting re-authorisation by a clinician.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                    <items id="text">Medication course cancelled</items>
                                    <items id="description">The planned course of medication has been cancelled prior to any administration.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                    <items id="text">Medication course postponed</items>
                                    <items id="description">The scheduled medication course has been postponed prior to any administration.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0015">
                                    <items id="text">Medication course stopped</items>
                                    <items id="description">Administration of the medication has been ceased during the period of the intended course.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                    <items id="text">Medication start date/condition set</items>
                                    <items id="description">The time to start the medication, or other starting condition, has been set.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                    <items id="text">Dose administration omitted</items>
                                    <items id="description">An administration of the medication has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                    <items id="text">Scheme of pharmacotherapy</items>
                                    <items id="description">Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item which was the focus of the activity.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Atenolol 100mg' or 'Tenormin tablets 100mg'. 
It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' is coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                    <items id="text">Reason</items>
                                    <items id="description">Reason that the pathway step for the identified medication was carried out.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Postponed - Patient not avalable at administration time', 'Cancelled - Adverse reaction'. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                                    <items id="text">Comment</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or pathway step not captured in other fields, including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Patient was in radiology department', 'Accidental injection into blood vessel during IM administration'.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                                    <items id="text">Sequence number</items>
                                    <items id="description">The sequence number specific to the pathway step being recorded.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: Vaccine sequence number.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0030">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0033">
                                    <items id="text">Patient guidance</items>
                                    <items id="description">Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0039">
                                    <items id="text">Major change to order</items>
                                    <items id="description">A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0041">
                                    <items id="text">Minor change to order</items>
                                    <items id="description">The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0043">
                                    <items id="text">Original scheduled date/time</items>
                                    <items id="description">The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0044">
                                    <items id="text">Dose administration deferred</items>
                                    <items id="description">An administration of a dose of the medication has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0053">
                                    <items id="text">Additional details</items>
                                    <items id="description">Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0085">
                                    <items id="text">Extension</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0103">
                                    <items id="text">Order ID</items>
                                    <items id="description">Unique identifier for the medication order.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0104">
                                    <items id="text">Medication details</items>
                                    <items id="description">Structured details about the medication including strength, form and constituent substances.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the dispensed, authorised or administered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0106">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription re-authorised</items>
                                    <items id="description">The original medication order has been re-authorised to allow repeat prescription or dispensing. In some jurisdictions an entirely new order must be issued in these circumstances.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0109">
                                    <items id="text">Medication recommended</items>
                                    <items id="description">The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0131">
                                    <items id="text">Amount</items>
                                    <items id="description">Specific details about the amount of the medication item.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">CLUSTER.dosage is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst CLUSTER.medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0132">
                                    <items id="text">Substitution</items>
                                    <items id="description">Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0133">
                                    <items id="text">Substitution reason</items>
                                    <items id="description">The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0138">
                                    <items id="text">Substitution performed</items>
                                    <items id="description">A medication was substituted which is bioequivalent to that ordered.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0139">
                                    <items id="text">Substitution not performed</items>
                                    <items id="description">Although allowed by the medication order a bioequvalent medication was not substituted.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0140">
                                    <items id="text">Administration details</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of body site and administration of the medication.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0141">
                                    <items id="text">Body site</items>
                                    <items id="description">Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. 
Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0142">
                                    <items id="text">Structured body site</items>
                                    <items id="description">Structured description of the site of administration of the medication, vaccine or therapeutic good.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: "On the medial skin surface of the left forearm, from 10 cm to 20 cm distally from the point of the elbow".</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0143">
                                    <items id="text">Administration method</items>
                                    <items id="description">The technique or device by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0144">
                                    <items id="text">Administration device</items>
                                    <items id="description">Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the medication.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0145">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription awaiting authorisation</items>
                                    <items id="description">Draft prescription has been prepared and is awaiting confirmation from an authorised clinician. May be used where reauthorisations are performed as a batch. This careflow_step may have a status of 'planned' or 'active', reflecting the need to to handle new orders as well as re-authorised orders.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0147">
                                    <items id="text">Route</items>
                                    <items id="description">The route by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered into the subject's body.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Comment: For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'. Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0148">
                                    <items id="text">Medication prepared</items>
                                    <items id="description">The medication has been physically prepared. For example: preparation of an intravenous mixture.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0149">
                                    <items id="text">Double-checked?</items>
                                    <items id="description">The pathway step has been checked by a separate individual.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">Details of the individual performing the double-check can be carried in the Reference Model element "Participation".</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0150">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription cancelled</items>
                                    <items id="description">The prescription was cancelled prior to being issued.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0151">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription invalid or expired</items>
                                    <items id="description">Prescription has been invalidated or has expired without being fulfilled.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0152">
                                    <items id="text">Prescription fulfilled</items>
                                    <items id="description">The prescription has been fulfilled successfully.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0153">
                                    <items id="text">Medication authorised</items>
                                    <items id="description">The medication has been formally authorised for use.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0154">
                                    <items id="text">Restart date/time</items>
                                    <items id="description">The date/time on which the medication course is set to restart, as per the "Administrations suspended" pathway step.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 2017-10-29</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0155">
                                    <items id="text">Restart criterion</items>
                                    <items id="description">The criterion which triggers the medication course to restart, as per the "Administrations suspended" pathway step.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: "On day 2 after surgery".</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0156">
                                    <items id="text">Other pharmacotherapy scheme</items>
                                    <items id="description">The clinical reason for the medication activity.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Angina' or 'Pain'. Coding of the indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. If only an ACTION is used to record a medication indication, this data element can be used without additional consideration. However, if a clinical indication is recorded for both the Medication order INSTRUCTION and this Medication management ACTION, be aware that these indications might not be consistent."</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                            </children>
                            <cardinality>
                                <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
                                <is_unique>false</is_unique>

                                    <lower_included>true</lower_included>
                                    <upper_included>false</upper_included>
                                    <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
                                    <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                                    <lower>0</lower>
                                </interval>
                            </cardinality>

                                                <archetype_id>
                                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.timing_nondaily.v1</value>
                                                </archetype_id>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                                    <items id="text">Response timing</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Structured information about the intended timing pattern for a therapeutic or diagnostic activity occurring over days, weeks, months or years.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                                    <items id="text">Specific date</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific date or a specific range of dates.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'on 12 Jan 2017' or 'on 30 Oct 2017 to 6 Nov 2017'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                                    <items id="text">Repetition interval</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The interval between repetitions of the activity.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Every 3 weeks'. If necessary, this element can be used to explicity specify that an activity is to take place every single day, by setting it to "1 day".</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                                    <items id="text">Specific day of week</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific day of the week.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'On Monday, Wednesday and Friday'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                                    <items id="text">Specific day of month</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on a specific day or interval of days of the month.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'on the 3rd, 13th and 23rd of each month' or 'on the 1st to the 10th of each month'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                                                    <items id="text">From event</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The name of the event that triggers the activity to take place.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">This element is intended for events that can occur at variable dates, such as onset of menstruation, and not for doses or activities that are conditional on a different varable. If required, the event name can be coded using a terminology, which could potentially be used to trigger an application to set a concrete date for the activity.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                                                    <items id="text">Therapy response timestamp</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place in relation to a specific named event.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                                                    <items id="text">Monday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Monday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                                                    <items id="text">Tuesday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Tuesday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                                                    <items id="text">Time of therapy response</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time before or after the named event when the activity should take place. Negative durations can be used to signify that the activity should be taken before a known event.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '3 days after onset of menstruation = menstrual onset + 3 days', '2 weeks prior to admission= admission -2 weeks'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0010">
                                                    <items id="text">On / off cycle</items>
                                                    <items id="description">A cycle of activity where an on-off pattern is required.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'take for 1 week, omit 2 weeks, repeat 4 times'</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0011">
                                                    <items id="text">On</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time for which the activity should take place.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0012">
                                                    <items id="text">Off</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The period of time for which the activity should NOT take place.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0013">
                                                    <items id="text">Repetitions</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The number of repetitions of the on/off cycle.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0014">
                                                    <items id="text">Frequency</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The number of days per time period on which the activity is to take place.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: '3 times per week', '2-4 times per month'.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0016">
                                                    <items id="text">Wednesday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Wednesday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0017">
                                                    <items id="text">Thursday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Thursday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                                                    <items id="text">Friday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Friday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                                                    <items id="text">Saturday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Saturday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                                                    <items id="text">Sunday</items>
                                                    <items id="description">The activity should take place on Sunday.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                                                    <items id="text">Timing description</items>
                                                    <items id="description">Text description of the timing.</items>
                                                    <items id="comment">For example: 'Use for one week, then stop for two weeks, then repeat'. This element is intended to allow implementers to use the structures for daily timings without necessarily specifying the non-daily timings in a structured way.</items>
                                                </term_definitions>
                                            </children>
                                            <cardinality>
                                                <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
                                                <is_unique>false</is_unique>
                                                <interval>
                                                    <lower_included>true</lower_included>
                                                    <upper_included>false</upper_included>
                                                    <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
                                                    <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
                                                    <lower>0</lower>
                                                </interval>
                                            </cardinality>
                                        </attributes>
                                    </children>
                                </attributes>
                                <archetype_id>
                                    <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.clinical_synopsis.v1</value>
                                </archetype_id>
                                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                                    <items id="text">Clinical synopsis</items>
                                    <items id="description">Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                                    <items id="text">List</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                                    <items id="text">Specific response</items>
                                    <items id="description">The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                                    <items id="text">Tree</items>
                                    <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                                    <items id="text">Extension</items>
                                    <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                                    <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                                </term_definitions>
                            </children>
                            <cardinality>

                        <archetype_id>
                            <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.procedure.v1</value>
                        </archetype_id>
                        <term_definitions code="at0000">
                            <items id="text">Colonoscopy</items>
                            <items id="description">A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0001">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0002">
                            <items id="text">Procedure name</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of the procedure by name.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0003">
                            <items id="text">Procedure detail</items>
                            <items id="description">Structured information about the procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0004">
                            <items id="text">Procedure planned</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure to be undertaken is planned.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0005">
                            <items id="text">Comment</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0006">
                            <items id="text">Complication</items>
                            <items id="description">Details about any complication arising from the procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. Examples: Hematuria after a kidney biopsy, tissue irritation after insertion of intravenous catheter.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0007">
                            <items id="text">Procedure request sent</items>
                            <items id="description">Request for procedure sent.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0014">
                            <items id="text">Reason</items>
                            <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0034">
                            <items id="text">X - Procedure planned</items>
                            <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
                            <items id="comment">(Was: The procedure to be undertaken is planned.)</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0035">
                            <items id="text">X - Procedure request sent</items>
                            <items id="description">This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.</items>
                            <items id="comment">(Was: Request for procedure sent.)</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0036">
                            <items id="text">Procedure scheduled</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure has been scheduled.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0038">
                            <items id="text">Procedure postponed</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure has been postponed.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0039">
                            <items id="text">Procedure cancelled</items>
                            <items id="description">The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0040">
                            <items id="text">Procedure suspended</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure has been suspended.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0041">
                            <items id="text">Procedure aborted</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure has been aborted.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0043">
                            <items id="text">Procedure completed</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0047">
                            <items id="text">Procedure performed</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0048">
                            <items id="text">Colonoscopy</items>
                            <items id="description">Outcome of procedure performed.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0049">
                            <items id="text">Description</items>
                            <items id="description">Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0053">
                            <items id="text">Tree</items>
                            <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0054">
                            <items id="text">Requestor order identifier</items>
                            <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
                            <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Placer Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0055">
                            <items id="text">Requestor</items>
                            <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0056">
                            <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
                            <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
                            <items id="comment">This is equivalent to Filler Order Number in HL7 v2 specifications.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0057">
                            <items id="text">Receiver</items>
                            <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0058">
                            <items id="text">Urgency</items>
                            <items id="description">Urgency of the procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0060">
                            <items id="text">Final end date/time</items>
                            <items id="description">The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure, was finished.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0061">
                            <items id="text">Total duration</items>
                            <items id="description">The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0062">
                            <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
                            <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0063">
                            <items id="text">Body site</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of the body site for the procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0064">
                            <items id="text">Extension</items>
                            <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                            <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0065">
                            <items id="text">Method</items>
                            <items id="description">Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0066">
                            <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
                            <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure scheduled' pathway step.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0067">
                            <items id="text">Procedure type</items>
                            <items id="description">The type of procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0068">
                            <items id="text">Procedure commenced</items>
                            <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0069">
                            <items id="text">Procedural difficulty</items>
                            <items id="description">Difficulties or issues encountered during performance of the procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Examples: The patient was agitated, insufficient emptying of the stomach before gastroscopy, a tumour in the bile ducts made it impossible to pass the scope through.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                        <term_definitions code="at0070">
                            <items id="text">Indication</items>
                            <items id="description">The clinical or process-related reason for the procedure.</items>
                            <items id="comment">Coding of the indication with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This data element allows multiple occurrences. For example: 'Failed bowel preparation' or 'Bowel cancer screening'.</items>
                        </term_definitions>
                    </children>
